body: Regional traits are tied to particular regions, often specific nations, territories, or cities in a campaign. The following regional traits present several “generic” regions that can be used in most campaign settings.
name: Regional Traits

sections.body: You were born and raised in rocky deserts. You are accustomed to high temperatures, and gain a +4 trait bonus on any saving throws made to resist the effects of being in hot conditions and a +1 trait bonus on all saving throws against fire effects.
sections.name: Desert Child
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/New Rules/Traits/Regional Traits/Desert Child

sections.body: You were born and raised in rugged badlands or hills, and you've become something of an expert at evading the predators, monsters, and worse that haunt the highlands. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Stealth checks, and Stealth is always a class skill for you. This trait bonus increases to +2 in hilly or rocky areas.
sections.name: Highlander

sections.body: The time you spent leaping between slippery logs as they whirled down the river to market taught you how to keep your footing. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Acrobatics checks and a +1 trait bonus to your CMB when attempting to resist trip attacks.
sections.name: Log Roller
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/New Rules/Traits/Regional Traits/Log Roller

sections.body: Your first job was serving in a civilian militia in your home town. Skills learned through daily drilling and protecting your fellow townsfolk gave you special insight into military life. Select one of the following skills: Profession (soldier), Ride, or Survival. You gain a +1 trait bonus on that skill, and it is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Militia Veteran
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/New Rules/Traits/Regional Traits/Militia Veteran

sections.body: You learned to swim right after you learned to walk. As a youth, a gang of river pirates put you to work swimming in nighttime rivers and canals with a dagger in your teeth so you could sever the anchor ropes of merchant vessels. You gain a +1 trait bonus on damage dealt with a dagger and a +1 trait bonus on Swim checks. Swim is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: River Rat
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/New Rules/Traits/Regional Traits/River Rat

sections.body: You were born and raised among rolling plains or savannas. You spent much of your youth exploring these vast reaches and know many of the savanna's secrets. Pick one of the following skills: Handle Animal, Knowledge (nature), or Ride. You gain a +1 trait bonus on that skill, and it is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Savanna Child
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/New Rules/Traits/Regional Traits/Savanna Child

sections.body: You grew up among the outcasts and outlaws of your society, learning to forage and survive in an urban environment. Select one of the following skills: Disable Device, Escape Artist, or Sleight of Hand. You gain a +1 trait bonus on that skill, and it is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Vagabond Child
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/New Rules/Traits/Regional Traits/Vagabond Child
